required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Myeloid-derived Suppressor Cells in Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Myeloid-derived Suppressor Cells in Colorectal Cancer: Influence on Postoperative Complications and Neoadjuvant Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate whether the preoperative level of myeloid-derived suppressor cells is associated with postoperative complications classified by Clavien-Dindo categories. Levels of all MDSC, polymorphonuclear MDSC (PMNMDSC), monocytic MDSC (MMDSC), early-stage MDSC (EMDSC) and monocytic to polymorphonuclear MDSC ratio (M/PMN MDCS) were established and compared in patients with postoperative complications, severe postoperative complications (>= IIIA according to Clavien-Dindo) and severe septic complications.

detailed_description.textblock: Levels of all MDSC, polymorphonuclear MDSC (PMNMDSC), monocytic MDSC (MMDSC), early-stage MDSC (EMDSC) and monocytic to polymorphonuclear MDSC ratio (M/PMN MDCS) were established and compared in patients with and without postoperative complications. Then subgroup analysis was performed to compare levels of MDSC in patients with severe postoperative complications (>= IIIA according to Clavien-Dindo) and those without severe complications. Another subgroup analysis will be performed for patients with severe septic complications that are defined as severe complications with accompanying infection. Levels of MDSC will be compared by means of U Mann Whitney test as their distribution is not normal. After above mentioned analyses it will be possible to evaluate the role of MDSC in patients with colorectal cancer in terms of postoperative complications. Additional analyse will be performed to compare levels of MDSC in patients who underwent neoadjuvant treatment (radiotherapy or chemoradiotherapy).

primary_outcome.measure: Level of MDSC in patients with postoperative complications
primary_outcome.description: Level of all MDSC, polymorphonuclear MDSC (PNMMDSC), monocytic MDSC ( MMDSC), early-stage MDSC (EMDSC) and monocytic to polymorphonuclear MDSC ratio (M/PMNMDSC) in patients with postoperative complications

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of MDSC in patients with severe postoperative complications
secondary_outcome.description: Level of all MDSC, PNMMDSC, MMDSC, EMDSC and M/PMNMDSC ratio in patients with severe postoperative complications (Clavien-Dindo>= IIIA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of MDSC in patients with severe septic postoperative complications
secondary_outcome.description: Level of all MDSC, PNMMDSC, MMDSC, EMDSC and M/PMNMDSC ratio in patients with severe postoperative complications (Clavien-Dindo>= IIIA) with infection

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of MDSC in patients after neoadjuvant therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Level of all MDSC, PNMMDSC, MMDSC, EMDSC and M/PMNMDSC ratio in patients after neoadjuvant treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of MDSC in patients with T2-T4 tumours after neoadjuvant treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Level of all MDSC, PNMMDSC, MMDSC, EMDSC and M/PMNMDSC ratio in patients with tumours T2-T4 after neoadjuvant treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of MDSC measured in the specimen
secondary_outcome.description: evel of all MDSC, PNMMDSC, MMDSC, EMDSC and M/PMNMDSC ratio measured in the specimen after resection

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of MDSC in patients with left and right sided tumours
secondary_outcome.description: evel of all MDSC, PNMMDSC, MMDSC, EMDSC and M/PMNMDSC ratio measured in patients with left-sided and right-sided colorectal cancer

arm_group.description: Patients with colorectal cancer qualified for elective operations.

intervention.description: Establishing of levels of all MDSC, PMNMDSC, MMDSC, EMDSC, M/PMN MDSC ratio on the day before operation.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with histologically-confirmed colorectal cancer who undergo elective surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age â‰¥ 18
- colorectal cancer confirmed by histological examination of biopsy specimen
- elective operation
- signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Emergency operation
- General condition that precludes understanding and signing of the informed consent form
